name: Avoid Implementation files with a very low comment/code ratio
description:
Implementation files should have at least a ratio comment/code > X %
The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.

Note: Implementation files are files ending with .c, .cpp or .cc
output:
Associated to each C/C++ implementation file with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The comment/code ratio
rationale: Maintainability of the code is facilitated if there is documentation in the code. This rule will ensure there are comments within the artifact.
remediation: Enrich artifact code with comments to describe the functional expectations and the technical characteristic of the code.
